channel.title: Favorite Weapons
channel.description:
What is your favorite weapon of all time? That gun or blade or blunt object that you either have or would love to have? My personal favorite weapon is:
![](upload://sXeZQ8yEANgEiGMg5tFoKPQHASQ.jpeg)
EDIT: I actually forgot another one of my favorites. Reading Pokemon Eater's post reminded me: [img]https://www.tbns.net/arvex/pics/bastard.jpg[/img]
I used to have one somewhat like this, but somehow it got broken. Terrible craftsmanship, but then again there are very few swords made by true master blacksmiths nowadays. Probably because metal smithing is almost a completely dead art.
So what are your favorites?

item.title: Favorite Weapons
item.dc:creator: DrasarSalman
item.description:
My finger: Poking people in the eye is efficient
My boot: Kicking men in the balls are even more effective
Pepper spray: Possibly even more effective than the boot to the genitals
A tazer: It is fun
A knife: Just in case…

By reading this post you have completed self defense course for women, pick up any object to one of your sides and pretend it is a trophy.

item.description:
I’ve always favored the Glock 17 as a sidearm.

Other than that, it would be nice to have some concealable daggers/switchblades I could tuck into my sleeves.

[COLOR=‘Black’]Note: This does not mean I actually have a Glock 17. But if I had a sidearm, it would be a Glock.

jerry:

Yeah, you should make sure NPCs enter their death sequences properly in real life.

Or put 3000 bullets in one magazine that could hold maximum 7!

DethklokSoldier:

Shit. Did I just break one of those unwritten rules, or are you referring to the time before the crash?

There is an arrow on the right side of the name of the person I got the comment from. Click it, and get teleported to the thread that was made after the crash!

item.title: Favorite Weapons
item.dc:creator: DrasarSalman
item.description:
I wish real life had a developer tool:

King Of Sandvich:

Best weapon? The Console!

bind t “ent_fire !picker sethealth 0”

It’s not considered a cheat in HL2 single player, and it makes whatever I’m looking at drop dead regardless of its strength (Striders, Gunships, and Antlion Guards included), breaks physics objects, explodes barrels, and clears barriers. Plus, it doesn’t break scripting on stuff you’re supposed to kill because NPCs enter their death sequences properly.

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite Weapons
item.dc:creator: DethklokSoldier
item.description:
Jeannotvb:

cat litter

Before or after the cat uses it?

Pokemon Eater:

You know what? Fuck guns. Fuck almost any ranged weapon, especially guns and crossbows. Any pissant piece of shit can learn how to use a crossbow or gun in a couple of weeks or months and kill somebody of greater skill with a different or same weapon if they have even a single factor in their favor.

If you want a real weapon, a mark of being a complete badass, use a sword. Rapier, sabre, claymore, longsword, broadsword or just about anything will do if you’re serious about demonstrating skill and elegance. Not to mention, it’s a cool accessory.

Longbows are also acceptable weapons of skill and badassery. Bows and slings will be the only ranged weapons I’d accept to exist if I somehow had such a power.

I have to agree and disagree with your statement. Technically anyone can pick up any weapon and use it. However, to use it skillfully, like killing your target with a single swing or shot, you need years of practice. I do normally prefer swords to guns, but only because it seems to me that there was more honor in the world when the sword ruled. You actually had to face your opponent one on one. Armies may have marched into battle as a single entity, but when battle commenced it was less army vs. army than it was warrior vs. warrior, and the most skilled warrior won.

Read full topic
